title: The TeamLiquid hate is real
body:
man the forums are so salty about TL winning. it took TL a while to close out the game, but that was less about TL being unable to close, and more about TSM defending extremely well. 

seriously, why all the hate? do the TSM fans just flock to the forums after TSM loses and trash the other team? is your confidence in your team shattered so easily? lol. everyone had bad games, TSM is still #1 in the bracket.

proud of my boys on TL!

replies.body: I do like TSM, I do agree that TSM played poorly this game. Like what the hell as Dyrus doing all game, Bjergsen was in this game? But the fact that TL took that long to close out the game was pretty bad.

> [{quoted}](name=ZeroAnarchy,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=NEhin6RJ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-22T22:51:15.773+0000)
>
> I do like TSM, I do agree that TSM played poorly this game. Like what the hell as Dyrus doing all game, Bjergsen was in this game? But the fact that TL took that long to close out the game was pretty bad.

i like TSM as well, but ive been a Curse/TL fan for much longer. yeah Dyrus had a really bad game, not sure what happened there. he just made a ton of bad decisions. and i also thing Bjerg needs to be on assassin, that seems to be where he is best.
TL took a while to close out, those end game fights were pretty poor(unless you were WildTurtle). But a win is a win, even if its sloppy :p

Actually I think whenever Bjerg is at his best is when he's on a control mage like Xerath or Ahri. While this was a win, it wasn't a good one. If TL wants to do well internationally, they need to close out games better, otherwise better teams will punish them HARD for it.

I admit im pretty mad about TL winning, I think that TSM deserved to win after a penta kill, an almost penta, and surviving thru 3? 5 dragon buffs and 2 baron buffs. However TL did a great job the whole early/mid game. I also think bjergson was stupid in picking Cass, Xerath and Ahri were open. But gj to TL for beating the #1 team

The whole reason Turtle could go off as he did was the counter-engage that cassio provided to the team. 2 seconds of 3-4 members of TL just staring at the screen while Jinx rips them apart. It is the majority of the reason for that stall-out until the backdoor job.

> [{quoted}](name=Vixanys,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=NEhin6RJ,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2015-02-23T14:44:30.005+0000)
>
> The whole reason Turtle could go off as he did was the counter-engage that cassio provided to the team. 2 seconds of 3-4 members of TL just staring at the screen while Jinx rips them apart. It is the majority of the reason for that stall-out until the backdoor job.

Yes, but I'm saying I think he would've performed better on a different champion. It's not that he played bad, but he looked uncomfortable on her. TSM kicked into gear too late in that game.

I respectfully disagree. While he wasn't on a play-making champion which may have helped. TSM's entire game (up until the massive defensive) was subpar and really bad.

I still believe it he had been on a play-making champion (as normal) and they still played as badly as they did pre-30 minutes. That massive defensive would never have happened and would have resulted in a quicker finish to the game.

i also believed Dyrus would of been wayy better of finishing his {{item:3151}}  instead of delaying if for so long.
the added damage potential with Liandry's + Equalizer might have made TSM's mid game stronger.

seeing as he wasnt able to even smack an Hourglass let alone ult a few times via the locks from TL's Annie and Lissandra.
wont dispute how well TSM defended, they did a great job. and i agree with the Cassio pick, really strange considering what was available.
I didn't like bjerg on the Cassio pick, she doesn't seem like his style of champion. I'm glad TL won though, even if it was messy.
Yeah, Bjergsen looked very uncomfortable on Cassio, like Xerath was open, why not take him? Props to TL winning though, but they really could of close that out much better.

The whole reason Turtle could go off as he did was the counter-engage that cassio provided to the team. 2 seconds of 3-4 members of TL just staring at the screen while Jinx rips them apart.  It is the majority of the reason for that stall-out until the backdoor job.
Dyrus needs lessons on how to {{champion:68}} from Balls
My only complaint about TL was choosing Corki into an ap heavy comp since Corki does mixed damage. I would have preferred to see Caitlyn or Tristana.
bunch of fucking tsm cry babies. We know LPL LCK are way better. stop acting like real shits and get your mind straight pussies.
